findings.description: Conflicting housing length specifications within PDF. Graph matches the dimension table (p12) and sortiment overview (p3), but contradicts the product description text (p11).
findings.recommendation: Retain current graph values as they match the detailed dimension table, but note the PDF inconsistency.

findings.description: Graph excludes FZ (Förzinkat) material for GDMI, likely based on Page 11 text stating 'vanligen i ZM'. However, Page 3 'Material' section implies FZ is common for the range.
findings.pdf_says: Page 11: 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM.' Page 3: 'De vanligaste är FZ, ZM, RF'
findings.recommendation: Verify if FZ is available for GDMI. If strictly following Page 11, graph is correct.

findings.description: Graph lists GDMI FLEX available materials as FZ, AZ, ZM, but the PDF material icons for GDMI FLEX show only FZ, AZ, ZM (no RF/SF) and the text states 'tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i rostfritt.' The graph is OK on icons but is inconsistent with its own option 'Förmonterad filterskena...' being coded with material FZ in example while family header says FZ/AZ/ZM without stating default; needs explicit exclusion of RF/SF and clarify default.
findings.pdf_says: GDMI FLEX page: icons show FZ, AZ, ZM; text: 'GDMI FLEX tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i rostfritt.'
findings.graph_says: Available materials: FZ, AZ, ZM (no explicit 'not RF/SF' constraint beyond list; also lists option PF with material FZ in example code).
findings.recommendation: Add explicit constraints/notes in KG that RF and SF are NOT available for GDMI FLEX (not just omitted), and set an explicit default material (ZM) per PDF text.

findings.description: Graph limits GDMI materials to AZ and ZM only, but the PDF section header for GDMI shows only AZ and ZM icons (correct). However, the PDF text also says 'Ej i Rostfritt' (not stainless). Graph is missing an explicit prohibition note (important for recommendations in corrosive environments).
findings.pdf_says: GDMI page: icons AZ, ZM; text: 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i Rostfritt.'
findings.graph_says: Available materials: AZ, ZM (default ZM) with no explicit 'RF/SF not available' rule.
findings.recommendation: Add an explicit rule/flag 'stainless_not_available=true' or equivalent for GDMI to prevent incorrect material recommendations.

findings.description: Graph says PT available materials include AZ/SF/ZM 'on request'. The PDF PT table lists only FZ as material for the standard sizes and states other materials are made on request, but does not enumerate which materials. Graph’s enumerated on-request materials may be unsubstantiated.
findings.pdf_says: PT page: size table material column shows FZ for listed sizes; note: 'Övriga material, storlekar eller längder tillverkas på begäran.'
findings.graph_says: Available materials: FZ (default), AZ (on request), SF (on request), ZM (on request).
findings.recommendation: Either (a) remove the specific on-request material list and replace with 'OTHER_MATERIALS_ON_REQUEST', or (b) cite an internal source confirming AZ/SF/ZM are valid for PT.

findings.description: Graph enumerates AZ/RF/SF/ZM as on-request for TT, but the PDF TT tables show only FZ for listed sizes and only a generic statement that other materials can be made on request (no list).
findings.pdf_says: TT page: listed rows show material FZ; note: 'Övriga material, storlekar eller längder tillverkas på begäran.'
findings.graph_says: Available materials: FZ (default), AZ (on request), RF (on request), SF (on request), ZM (on request).
findings.recommendation: Do not enumerate on-request materials unless the PDF (or another governed source) explicitly lists them; store as 'on request' without specific codes.

findings.description: Graph includes 'Max Chlorine PPM' values per material sourced from 'EXTERNAL_ENGINEERING_REFERENCE'. The PDF material page provides ONLY corrosion classes (C3/C4/C5/C5.1/C5) and standards/grades, not chlorine ppm. These attributes are not verifiable against the PDF and may be treated as catalog facts incorrectly.
findings.pdf_says: Material page lists: FZ=C3 (Z275), AZ=C4, RF=C5 (EN 1.4301), SF=C5.1 (EN 1.4404), ZM=C5 (ZM310). No chlorine ppm data.
findings.graph_says: Material nodes include chlorine ppm limits and sources external.
findings.recommendation: Mark chlorine ppm as non-catalog / engineering-augmented attributes with provenance, and exclude them from PDF-truth validation scope (or store in a separate layer).

findings.description: Graph lists GDP available materials as FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM. The PDF GDP page shows material icons (FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM) which matches. However, the GDP 'UTFÖRANDE' text says 'tillverkas vanligen i förzinkat' and corrosion class C2 for execution. Graph sets default frame depth 25mm, but PDF states 'Standard är 250 mm längd ... 25, 50 eller 100 mm standarddjup på ramen' (i.e., all three are standard depths, not options only).
findings.pdf_says: GDP: '...25, 50 eller 100 mm standarddjup på ramen.'
findings.graph_says: Default frame depth: 25mm; Frame Depth values [25,50,100] but treated as variable/options.
findings.recommendation: Represent 25/50/100 as standard supported variants (not only 'options'), and ensure configurator treats them as standard selectable without surcharge unless pricing data says otherwise.

findings.description: Graph code format uses {family}-{width}x{height}-{depth}-{material}. PDF example uses 'PFF-600x600-25-FZ' (matches), but PDF explicitly indicates options 'Ram djup 50 = 50 (pristillägg)' and 'Ram djup 100 = 100 (pristillägg)'. Graph lacks option pricing/flag, but more importantly does not constrain depth to only 25/50/100 (it is implied but should be explicit).
findings.pdf_says: PFF example: 'PFF-600x600-25-FZ'; options: depth 50 or 100.
findings.graph_says: Code format generic; sizes list includes depth variants but no explicit allowed depth set constraint at family-level.
findings.recommendation: Add explicit allowed depth enumeration {25,50,100} at family level and store option surcharge flag for 50/100 if pricing model exists.

findings.description: PDF contents page lists 'PTT' (Plan övergång?) and 'TT' plus 'EXL' and 'Filer Profil'. Graph includes PT and TT, EXL and Filter Profil, but does NOT include a separate family/node for PTT. If PTT is distinct from PT (naming differs), it is missing.
findings.pdf_says: Contents: 'PTT' and 'TT'. Product pages show 'PT' plan övergång and 'TT' konisk övergång.
findings.recommendation: Confirm whether 'PTT' is a typo/legacy name for PT. If distinct, add PTT as separate family with its own table; if not, add alias/synonym node 'PTT' -> 'PT'.

findings.description: One weight in the GDB table appears transcribed incorrectly in the graph: size 1800x900 has short weight 36 kg in graph, but PDF row shows (Vikt 750/800 = 77, Vikt 550/600 = 56? actually the PDF row shows '77' under 750/800 and '36' under 550/600 in the screenshot, which is likely a PDF error because 1800x900 should not weigh less than 1800x600 (47) or 1500x900 (56). Graph flags this as SUSPECTED_PDF_ERROR but still stores 36 as short weight. This can cause wrong logistics/selection.
findings.pdf_says: GDB table row '1800x900' shows '77' (750/800) and '36' (550/600) in the provided PDF image.
findings.recommendation: Escalate to catalog owner to confirm correct 550/600 weight for 1800x900; until confirmed, store as 'unknown' or 'requires verification' rather than a likely-wrong numeric value.

findings.description: PDF text for GDC FLEX says 'Finns som standard i 750 mm och 900 mm längd' while the dimension table columns are labeled 750/800 and 900/950 (to reflect PG vs flange). Graph encodes 750/800 and 900/950 which is fine, but it describes max filter depth 450/600mm like GDC; PDF only states max length 450 mm cartridge and options for 600 mm cylinder in the note block. Max filter depth field is not explicitly stated as 450/600 for GDC FLEX in the PDF.
findings.pdf_says: GDC FLEX: '... 750 mm och 900 mm längd ... patronfilter med maxlängd 450 mm' and later note about 900/950 for 600 mm cylinder / polisfilter.
findings.graph_says: Length variants include '[max filter depth 450mm]' and '[max filter depth 600mm]'.
findings.recommendation: Rename 'max filter depth' to 'max cartridge length' for GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX (it is not a filter depth in mm like bag/compact filters).

findings.description: Graph uses 'max filter depth 450/600mm' on length variants for GDC, but PDF describes cartridge cylinder lengths (450 mm and 600 mm) and polisfilter downstream. This is a semantic mismatch that can break compatibility logic (depth vs length).
findings.pdf_says: GDC: '... maxlängd 450 mm ... Längd 900/950 för 600 mm cylinder ... 450 mm cylinder + polisfilter'.
findings.graph_says: Length variants annotated as 'max filter depth 450mm' / 'max filter depth 600mm'.
findings.recommendation: Change property to 'max_cartridge_length_mm' (450/600) and add polisfilter downstream compatibility as an option/feature for 900/950.

findings.description: Same semantic mismatch as above: cartridge systems use cylinder length, not filter depth. Graph uses 'max filter depth 450/600mm'.
findings.pdf_says: GDMI FLEX: '... patronfilter med maxlängd 600 mm ... Längd 850/900 för 450 mm cylinder; Längd 1100/1150 för 600 mm cylinder + polisfilter'.
findings.graph_says: Length variants annotated as max filter depth 450/600.
findings.recommendation: Replace with max_cartridge_length_mm and model polisfilter option explicitly.

findings.description: Graph sets construction to SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED, but PDF states cabinet is single-wall uninsulated while the service door is double-skin and heat/condensation insulated as standard. Graph does capture 'Door insulation: DOUBLE_WALL_HEAT_CONDENSATION', but construction label 'UNINSULATED' may mislead if interpreted as 'no insulation anywhere'.
findings.pdf_says: GDB: '... oisolerat enkelväggsutförande med en servicelucka som är dubbelmantlad och värme/kondensisolerad som standard.'
findings.recommendation: Refine construction taxonomy to distinguish 'cabinet_wall_type' vs 'door_construction' to avoid contradictory inferences.

findings.description: Same issue as GDB: cabinet is single-wall uninsulated; service door is double-skin insulated. Graph has door insulation, but the construction term can be misinterpreted.
findings.pdf_says: GDC: '... oisolerat enkelväggsutförande med en servicelucka som är dubbelmantlad och värme/kondensisolerad som standard.'
findings.recommendation: Split construction fields as above.

findings.description: Same as GDB/GDC. Additionally PDF states 'GDC FLEX levereras med utdragbar kolfilterplatta' (standard). Graph includes this as standard feature (correct).
findings.pdf_says: GDC FLEX text includes insulated service door as standard.
findings.recommendation: Split cabinet wall vs door construction.

findings.description: PDF header icons for GDB show FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM (all five). Graph matches. But PDF 'UTFÖRANDE' says 'tillverkas vanligen i förzinkat' and corrosion class C2 for execution; graph default material is FZ (correct). No discrepancy.
findings.pdf_says: GDB icons show all five materials.
findings.graph_says: Available materials: FZ(default), AZ, RF, SF, ZM.

findings.description: In the PDF GDMI FLEX table, the header for weights appears duplicated/mistyped ('Vikt kg 1100/1150' repeated). Graph stores two weight columns (short vs long) correctly as 850 and 1100 variants; but you should store provenance that PDF header is malformed to avoid ETL confusion.

findings.recommendation: Add ETL note: 'PDF header typo; interpreted as short=850/900 and long=1100/1150'.

findings.description: PDF includes 'Övergång & Tillbehör' section with EXL and Filter Profil; graph includes them. However the PDF also shows 'Mätuttag' and 'Tryckmätningsnipplar ingår' as standard features on cabinets (GDP/GDB/GDMI/GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX). Graph does not model these features as options/standard features, which limits recommendation and BOM completeness.

findings.graph_says: No explicit standard feature nodes/properties for pressure taps.

findings.description: PDF states standard connection is PG 20 mm and optional is flange 40 mm. Graph models option code F but does not explicitly store PG=20mm vs flange=40mm as connection dimension attributes for GDP (it only uses connection type codes).

findings.description: Graph code format is 'EXL-{width} {material}' (space-separated), while PDF example is 'EXL-600 AZ' (also space-separated) but your KG dimension module lists '300xNone' etc, implying WxH. EXL is 1D length/size, not WxH; representing as '300xNone' is inconsistent.
findings.recommendation: Model EXL dimension as a single 'length_mm' property (not WxH) and adjust dimension node schema for 1D accessories.

findings.description: PDF name is 'FILTER PROFIL' and example code 'Filter profil-600 FZ'. Graph code format uses 'Filter profil-{width} {material}' (space-separated) but the DimensionModules again encode as '200xNone' with separate depth variants. This should be modeled as (width_mm, depth_mm) rather than WxH with None.
findings.pdf_says: Filter profil: sizes 200..1800 and depths 20/50/100; example 'Filter profil-600 FZ'.
findings.graph_says: DimensionModule uses width as 'Size (WxH)=200xNone' and depth separately.
findings.recommendation: Change schema for Filter Profil to properties: width_mm and depth_mm; remove fake height=None.

findings.description: PDF states EXL is 'vanligen i aluzink' (AZ) corrosion class C4. It does not show other material options. Graph lists available materials FZ, AZ, RF, ZM. Those additional materials are not supported by the PDF and may be incorrect.
findings.pdf_says: EXL: 'Utförs vanligen i aluzink. Korrosivitets klass C4.' (no other materials listed).
findings.graph_says: Available materials: FZ, AZ (default), RF, ZM.
findings.recommendation: Restrict EXL materials to AZ only unless a governed source confirms other materials; or mark other materials as 'on request' with provenance.

findings.description: PDF indicates Filter Profil example is FZ and does not list other materials; also the icons shown at top for the accessory page include AZ/RF/FZ/ZM but not explicitly tied to Filter Profil availability. Graph restricts Filter Profil to FZ only (likely correct). However, the accessory page icons could be misread as available materials for both EXL and Filter Profil; KG should store per-product material availability explicitly sourced.
findings.pdf_says: Filter Profil example uses FZ; no explicit 'available materials list'.
findings.recommendation: Attach explicit provenance to Filter Profil material availability (e.g., 'only FZ per example; others not specified') to avoid later broadening based on page icons.

findings.description: Graph includes environment/application/stressor nodes not present in the PDF catalog. This is acceptable as augmentation, but must be clearly separated from catalog-truth to avoid being flagged as discrepancies by downstream auditors.
findings.pdf_says: Catalog is product/technical tables; no environment/application ontology.
findings.recommendation: Label Layer 2 as 'derived/heuristic' and exclude from PDF truth comparisons in governance rules.

findings.description: Graph notes a source conflict for GDMI lengths: text says 550/600 and 800/850, while sortiment + table show 600/650 and 850/900. This is correct to flag, but KG currently chooses table values. Without storing both (as 'marketing_text_length_mm' vs 'manufacturing_length_mm'), users might see inconsistencies when comparing to narrative sections.
findings.graph_says: Uses 600 and 850 codes with 600/650 and 850/900 as authoritative; flags conflict in notes.
findings.recommendation: Store both representations with provenance and add a single canonical field used for configuration (table-based).

findings.description: Cartridge counts in graph match the PDF tables for all listed rows (e.g., GDC 600x600=16; GDMI FLEX 1200x900=38; GDC FLEX 1800x600=42). No discrepancies found, but KG should store that these are 'Antal patroner' (count) and not capacity; the separate 'CapacityRules capacity/component=125' is not in PDF.
findings.pdf_says: Tables list 'Antal patroner' per size.
findings.graph_says: Cartridges stored; also capacity rules at 125 per component (not from PDF).
findings.recommendation: Keep cartridge counts as catalog-truth; mark '125 capacity/component' as non-catalog engineered assumption with provenance.

openai.summary:
Across the core cabinet families (GDP, GDB, GDMI, GDC, GDC FLEX, GDMI FLEX), the graph largely matches the PDF on the numeric tables (sizes, airflow and most weights, cartridge counts) and on the material icon availability per family. The biggest catalog-integrity risks are (1) semantic mis-modeling of cartridge cylinder length as 'max filter depth' for GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX, which can directly break filter compatibility logic, and (2) at least one likely-wrong weight value in the GDB table (1800x900 short length) that is currently stored numerically despite being flagged as suspicious.

A second cluster of issues is governance/provenance: the graph enumerates on-request materials for PT/TT without PDF support, adds chlorine ppm limits not present in the PDF, and includes Layer-2 environment/application heuristics that must be clearly separated from catalog-truth. Finally, accessory modeling (EXL, Filter Profil) should be changed from fake WxH shapes (e.g., 300xNone) to correct 1D/2D parameter models to prevent downstream code-format and selection bugs.

findings.description: GDMI page 11 shows only AZ and ZM material icons. The graph correctly lists only AZ and ZM. However, the graph notes say 'Ei i Rostfritt' (not in stainless) which is correct. But the PDF text on page 11 says 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ei i Rostfritt.' - the graph excludes RF and SF correctly. No discrepancy here - CONFIRMED CORRECT.
findings.pdf_says: AZ, ZM icons shown on page 11
findings.recommendation: No action needed - graph is correct.

findings.description: GDMI FLEX page 18 shows FZ, AZ, and ZM material icons (three icons visible). The graph lists FZ, AZ, ZM which matches. However, the PDF text says 'GDMI FLEX tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i rostfritt.' The graph does not have RF or SF which is correct. But the graph does not set ZM as default - it lists FZ first without marking a default.
findings.pdf_says: FZ, AZ, ZM icons on page 18; text says 'vanligen i ZM'
findings.graph_says: FZ, AZ, ZM (no explicit default marked)
findings.recommendation: Set ZM as the default material for GDMI FLEX, matching the PDF text 'vanligen i ZM'.

findings.description: GDC FLEX page 16 shows FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM material icons (all five). The graph lists FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM. However, the graph does not set FZ as default. The PDF text says 'GDC FLEX tillverkas vanligen i förzinkat' so FZ should be default.

The graph lists FZ (default), AZ (on request), SF (on request), ZM (on request) - omitting RF. This appears correct since RF icon is greyed. However, the graph should verify the greyed-out icon interpretation.

The PDF table only shows FZ material for all TT sizes. The text says 'Övriga material, storlekar eller längder tillverkas på begäran' which supports other materials on request.

anthropic_opus.summary:
The Knowledge Graph is generally well-constructed and captures the vast majority of data from the PDF catalog accurately. All 12 product families are present, and the dimension tables for GDP (35 sizes), GDB (27 sizes), GDMI (35 sizes), GDC (12 sizes), GDC FLEX (6 sizes), GDMI FLEX (8 sizes), BFF (5 sizes), and PFF (25 sizes) are complete with correct airflow ratings, weights, cartridge counts, and module configurations. The material availability per family is correctly mapped, and the accessory products (PT, TT, EXL, Filter Profil) are all represented.

The most significant findings are: (1) A suspected PDF error in GDB 1800x900 short weight (36 kg vs expected ~62 kg) which the graph correctly flags; (2) A known source conflict in GDMI between text-stated lengths (550/600, 800/850) and table-stated lengths (600/650, 850/900) which the graph documents; (3) A similar weight column labeling issue in GDMI FLEX where both columns appear labeled identically; (4) A potential module count error in GDB 600x900 where the graph shows ½=1 instead of ¼=1; and (5) A naming convention inconsistency in GDC FLEX where the first size '600x300' has Bredd=300 and Höjd=600, which may cause confusion.

Overall, the graph scores well on completeness and accuracy. The main areas for improvement are: correcting the GDB 600x900 module count interpretation, adding explicit documentation for the GDMI FLEX weight column labeling error, and ensuring consistent width/height conventions across all product families. The graph's approach of documenting source conflicts rather than silently choosing one interpretation is commendable engineering practice.

challenged_findings.reason: The graph correctly transcribes the value '36' from the PDF (Page 9, row 1800x900) and flags it as a suspected error. The finding claims the graph is incorrect for storing the value, but the graph's role is to represent the catalog data (even errors) while flagging them. The PDF value is indeed 36.

A 'CRITICAL' severity for missing an explicit 'not_available' flag is unwarranted unless the schema strictly requires negative assertions. The graph matches the PDF's positive list.

gemini_pro.final_assessment: The graph is generally high quality, faithfully transcribing complex tables and correctly identifying internal PDF conflicts (e.g., GDMI lengths). The primary issues are missing default material assignments for GDMI FLEX and GDC FLEX where the text specifies a 'common' (vanligen) material. The graph also correctly identifies a likely PDF error in the GDB module configuration (600x900) and weight (1800x900), though the module correction causes a mismatch with the visual PDF data. My initial concern regarding GDMI material availability (FZ) is retracted as the specific product page (p11) overrides the general introduction (p3).

The GDMI product page explicitly limits materials via icons to AZ and ZM, and states it is not available in stainless. The general 'VID VAL AV SKÅP TÄNK PÅ: MATERIAL' sentence listing common materials for the whole cabinet range is not a per-family availability statement.

It should be modeled as 'other materials on request' without specifying which ones, unless the graph treats those values as non-catalog assumptions.

openai.final_assessment: Peer review confirms several real issues: (1) GDMI length values are internally inconsistent in the PDF and the graph should keep the table-based values while noting the conflict; (2) default material choices should follow 'vanligen i …' text (notably ZM default for GDMI FLEX, FZ default for GDC FLEX and likely also GDC/GDP); (3) the anomalous GDB 1800x900 short-weight value (36 kg) is present in the PDF and should remain flagged as suspected PDF error; and (4) at least one GDB module-count transcription error (600x900) is likely. Conversely, claims that GDMI should include FZ based on the general 'common materials' statement are not supported by the GDMI-specific page, and enumerating specific 'on request' materials for PT/TT is not verifiable because the PDF only says 'other materials on request' without listing them. After incorporating these corrections/constraints and retracting the GDP frame-depth point (which is not clearly a graph error), the graph appears moderately accurate but still has several catalog-truth/provenance gaps that can affect configuration and recommendations.

challenged_findings.reason: The PDF GDP page 5 text says 'Standard är 250 mm längd för plan, pleat och panelfilter med 25, 50 eller 100 mm standarddjup på ramen.' This means the cabinet is 250mm long and the filter frame depths of 25, 50, 100 are all standard depths that fit. However, the example description table on page 5 shows 'Ram Djup = 50' as the standard value, and the Options section explicitly states 'Ram djup 50 = 50' and 'Ram djup 100 = 100' as options. The word 'standarddjup' in the text refers to the standard frame depths available in the market (25, 50, 100mm), not that all three are default. The example code GDP-600x600-50-R-PG-FZ uses 50 as the example depth. So treating 25 as default with 50 and 100 as options is a reasonable interpretation, though 50 appears to be the example standard.

anthropic_opus.final_assessment: The graph has several areas of accuracy but also meaningful gaps and issues. The three evaluators converge on several key findings: (1) The GDMI length specification conflict between text (550/600, 800/850) and table (600/650, 850/900) is a genuine PDF inconsistency that the graph handles reasonably by following the table values. (2) The GDB 1800x900 weight of 36 kg for the short variant is almost certainly a PDF typo and is correctly flagged. (3) Material availability for GDMI and GDMI FLEX correctly excludes RF/SF but needs explicit prohibition notes. (4) Default materials need to be explicitly set for several families (GDMI FLEX should default to ZM, GDP and GDB to FZ). (5) The chlorine PPM data in the graph is not sourced from the PDF and should be clearly marked as external engineering data. (6) Module count data for GDB 600x900 appears incorrectly transcribed. (7) The PT/PTT naming discrepancy between contents page and product page is a minor PDF inconsistency. (8) On-request material enumeration for PT and TT transitions is partially supported by material icons but should be noted as inferred for TT. Overall, the graph captures the core product structure well but needs refinement in default values, explicit material constraints, weight data validation, and provenance marking for non-catalog attributes. The revised score of 68 reflects these accumulated issues across multiple product families.

findings.description: PT (Plan Övergång) on page 22 shows material icons FZ, AZ, a greyed-out circle (likely RF unavailable), SF, and ZM. The table lists only FZ. The graph lists FZ (default), AZ (on request), SF (on request), ZM (on request) — omitting RF. This interpretation is reasonable based on the icon convention, but the greyed icon interpretation should be documented.
findings.pdf_says: Page 22: PT icons show FZ, AZ, greyed circle, SF, ZM; table shows FZ only; note about other materials on request.
findings.graph_says: FZ (default), AZ, SF, ZM (on request). RF omitted.
findings.recommendation: Add provenance note that PT on-request materials are inferred from material icons on page 22. Document the greyed RF icon interpretation.

findings.description: The graph includes 'Max Chlorine PPM' values per material sourced from an external engineering reference. The PDF material page (p4) provides ONLY corrosion classes (C3/C4/C5/C5.1) and standards/grades — no chlorine ppm data. These attributes are not verifiable against the PDF catalog.
findings.pdf_says: Page 4: FZ=C3 (Z275), AZ=C4, RF=C5 (EN 1.4301), SF=C5.1 (EN 1.4404), ZM=C5 (ZM310). No chlorine ppm data.
findings.graph_says: Material nodes include chlorine ppm limits sourced from EXTERNAL_ENGINEERING_REFERENCE.
findings.recommendation: Mark chlorine ppm as non-catalog / engineering-augmented attributes with explicit provenance. Exclude from PDF-truth validation scope or store in a separate data layer.

findings.description: The graph uses 'max filter depth' terminology for GDC length variants, but the PDF describes cartridge cylinder lengths (450mm and 600mm), not filter depth. This semantic mismatch can break compatibility logic. The 750/800 length accommodates 450mm cylinders; the 900/950 length accommodates either 450mm cylinders + polisfilter downstream, or 600mm cylinders.
findings.pdf_says: Page 14: 'patronfilter med maxlängd 450 mm'; notes: 'Längd 750/800 för 450 mm cylinder', 'Längd 900/950 för 450 mm cylinder + polisfilter', 'Längd 900/950 för 600 mm cylinder'.
findings.graph_says: Length variants annotated as 'max filter depth 450mm' / 'max filter depth 600mm'.
findings.recommendation: Rename property to 'max_cartridge_length_mm' (450/600). Add polisfilter downstream compatibility as an explicit option/feature for the 900/950 variant.

findings.description: Same semantic mismatch as GDC: the graph uses 'max filter depth' for cartridge cylinder length. GDC FLEX page 16 describes cylinder lengths of 450mm and 600mm.
findings.pdf_says: Page 16: 'patronfilter med maxlängd 450 mm'; notes about 900/950 for 600mm cylinder.
findings.graph_says: Length variants annotated as 'max filter depth'.
findings.recommendation: Rename to 'max_cartridge_length_mm'. Model polisfilter option explicitly for 900/950 variant.

findings.description: Same semantic mismatch: GDMI FLEX uses cartridge cylinder lengths (450mm and 600mm), not filter depth. Additionally, the PDF states 'Längd 1100/1150 för 600 mm cylinder + polisfilter' — the graph should not interpret this as '600mm cartridge OR 450mm+polisfilter' unless explicitly supported.
findings.pdf_says: Page 18: 'patronfilter med maxlängd 600 mm'; 'Längd 850/900 för 450 mm cylinder'; 'Längd 1100/1150 för 600 mm cylinder + polisfilter'.
findings.graph_says: Length variants annotated as 'max filter depth 450/600mm'.
findings.recommendation: Rename to 'max_cartridge_length_mm'. Model the 1100/1150 variant as specifically for '600mm cylinder + polisfilter' per the PDF text.

findings.description: The GDMI FLEX dimension table on page 18 has both weight column headers labeled 'Vikt kg 1100/1150' — a clear PDF formatting error. The first column should be 'Vikt kg 850/900' (short variant) based on the pattern used by all other product families (GDB, GDMI, GDC, GDC FLEX). The graph interprets the first column as short (850/900) weight and the second as long (1100/1150) weight, which is logically correct.
findings.pdf_says: Page 18: Both weight columns labeled 'Vikt kg 1100/1150' (PDF formatting error).
findings.graph_says: First column treated as 850/900 weight, second as 1100/1150 weight.
findings.recommendation: Document this as a PDF_FORMATTING_ERROR. The graph's interpretation is correct but should carry an explicit provenance note.

findings.description: GDC FLEX dimension table on page 16 shows the first size labeled '600x300' but with Bredd=300 and Höjd=600. This contradicts the WxH naming convention used throughout the catalog. All other GDC FLEX entries have Höjd=600, suggesting the table is consistent (Bredd varies, Höjd fixed at 600), but the size label '600x300' implies W=600, H=300. Compare with GDC page 14 where '600x300' has Bredd=600, Höjd=300. The graph stores this as '600x300' following the label, but the actual width is 300 and height is 600.
findings.pdf_says: Page 16: GDC FLEX '600x300' has Bredd=300, Höjd=600. Compare GDC page 14: '600x300' has Bredd=600, Höjd=300.
findings.recommendation: Verify whether GDC FLEX uses HxW naming for this entry or if the table has swapped Bredd/Höjd values. Store explicit width=300, height=600 properties to avoid ambiguity. Consider renaming to '300x600' for consistency with WxH convention.

findings.description: The graph sets construction to SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED for GDB, but the PDF states the cabinet body is single-wall uninsulated while the service door is double-skin and heat/condensation insulated as standard. The graph does capture door insulation separately, but the top-level 'UNINSULATED' label may mislead if interpreted as 'no insulation anywhere'.
findings.pdf_says: Page 8: 'oisolerat enkelväggsutförande med en servicelucka som är dubbelmantlad och värme/kondensisolerad som standard.'
findings.recommendation: Refine construction taxonomy to distinguish 'cabinet_wall_type: SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED' from 'door_construction: DOUBLE_WALL_INSULATED' to prevent contradictory inferences. Apply same fix to GDC and GDC FLEX.

findings.description: EXL is a 1D accessory (length only, no height). The graph encodes dimension modules as '300xNone', '600xNone', etc., using a WxH schema that doesn't apply. This is a schema mismatch that can cause downstream code-format and selection bugs.
findings.pdf_says: Page 23: EXL sizes are single lengths: 300, 600, 900, 1200, 1500, 1800, 2100, 2400. Example code: 'EXL-600 AZ'.
findings.recommendation: Model EXL dimension as a single 'length_mm' property (not WxH). Adjust dimension node schema for 1D accessories.

findings.description: Filter Profil is a 2D accessory (width + depth, no height). The graph encodes sizes as '200xNone' with separate depth variants, using a WxH schema that doesn't apply. The PDF shows width (200-1800) and depth (20/50/100) as the two parameters.
findings.pdf_says: Page 23: Filter Profil sizes 200-1800, depths 20/50/100. Example: 'Filter profil-600 FZ'.
findings.recommendation: Change schema for Filter Profil to properties: width_mm and depth_mm. Remove fake height=None.

findings.description: GDMI example code on page 11 uses AZ as material ('GDMI-600x600-600-R-PG-AZ'), but the text says 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM'. This is a PDF internal inconsistency between the example code and the stated default material. The graph notes this as a SOURCE CONFLICT and uses ZM as default, which is the correct approach.
findings.pdf_says: Page 11: Example code 'GDMI-600x600-600-R-PG-AZ'; text: 'tillverkas vanligen i ZM.'
findings.graph_says: Default material ZM; SOURCE CONFLICT noted.
findings.recommendation: Keep the SOURCE CONFLICT note. The text 'vanligen i ZM' should take precedence for default material over the example code.

findings.description: The PDF contents page (p2) lists 'PTT' while the actual product page (p22) labels the product 'PT' (PLAN ÖVERGÅNG) with example code 'PT-600x600-315-FZ'. The graph uses 'PT' which matches the authoritative product page. The 'PTT' on the contents page appears to be a typo.
findings.pdf_says: Page 2 contents: 'PTT'. Page 22 product heading: 'PT PLAN ÖVERGÅNG'. Example code: 'PT-600x600-315-FZ'.
findings.recommendation: Add an alias/synonym 'PTT' → 'PT' to handle the contents page naming. The product page is authoritative.

findings.description: Multiple product pages state 'Tryckmätningsnipplar ingår' (pressure measurement nipples included) as a standard feature for GDP, GDB, GDMI, GDC, GDC FLEX, and GDMI FLEX. The graph does not model this as an explicit standard feature property.
findings.pdf_says: Pages 5, 8, 11, 14, 16, 18: 'Tryckmätningsnipplar ingår.'
findings.graph_says: No explicit standard feature node/property for pressure measurement nipples.
findings.recommendation: Add standard feature 'pressure_measurement_nipples_included=true' to all relevant cabinet families.

findings.description: The graph includes Layer 2 environment/application/stressor nodes and capacity rules (e.g., 125 m³/h per cartridge component) that are not present in the PDF catalog. These are engineering augmentations that must be clearly separated from catalog-truth to avoid being treated as verified catalog data.
findings.pdf_says: Catalog contains product/technical tables only; no environment/application ontology or per-cartridge capacity rules.
findings.graph_says: Layer 2 contains environments/applications/stressors; capacity rules at 125 per component.
findings.recommendation: Label Layer 2 and all non-catalog attributes as 'derived/heuristic/external' with explicit provenance. Exclude from PDF-truth validation scope.

findings.description: GDMI page 11 states the cabinet is delivered in 'isolerat dubbelmantlat utförande i förzinkad plåt med ett ramverk av aluminiumprofil.' This means the inner construction always uses FZ (förzinkad) sheet metal regardless of the outer material choice (AZ or ZM). The graph lists only AZ and ZM as available materials without clarifying that these refer to the outer material, while the inner structure is always FZ.
findings.pdf_says: Page 11: 'GDMI levereras i isolerat dubbelmantlat utförande i förzinkad plåt med ett ramverk av aluminiumprofil.'
findings.graph_says: Materials: AZ, ZM only (no distinction between inner/outer).
findings.recommendation: Add a note that GDMI inner construction is always förzinkad plåt (FZ) with aluminium profile framework; AZ/ZM refers to the selectable outer material.

recommendations: P1-CRITICAL: Correct GDB 600x900 module count from ¼=0/½=1/1/1=1 to ¼=1/½=0/1/1=1 per PDF page 9 table.
P1-CRITICAL: Escalate GDB 1800x900 short-weight (36 kg) to catalog owner for verification; mark as 'requires_verification' until confirmed.
P2-MAJOR: Set explicit default materials for all families per 'vanligen i...' text: GDP=FZ, GDB=FZ, GDMI=ZM, GDC=FZ, GDC FLEX=FZ, GDMI FLEX=ZM.
P2-MAJOR: Add explicit 'stainless_not_available=true' constraint for GDMI and GDMI FLEX families.
P2-MAJOR: Rename 'max_filter_depth' to 'max_cartridge_length_mm' for all patron/cartridge families (GDC, GDC FLEX, GDMI FLEX) and model polisfilter as an explicit downstream option.
P2-MAJOR: Fix dimension schema for 1D/2D accessories: EXL should use 'length_mm' (not WxH); Filter Profil should use 'width_mm' + 'depth_mm' (not WxH with None).
P2-MAJOR: Verify GDC FLEX size '600x300' dimension assignment (Bredd=300, Höjd=600 per PDF) and ensure consistent WxH convention.
P3-MINOR: Refine construction taxonomy to separate 'cabinet_wall_type' from 'door_construction' for GDB, GDC, and GDC FLEX.
P3-MINOR: Mark all non-catalog attributes (chlorine ppm, capacity rules, environment/application nodes) with explicit provenance and exclude from PDF-truth validation.
P3-MINOR: Document all PDF internal inconsistencies (GDMI lengths, GDMI FLEX weight headers, GDMI example code material, PTT/PT naming) with SOURCE CONFLICT or PDF_ERROR flags.
P4-INFO: Replace specific on-request material enumeration for TT with generic 'OTHER_MATERIALS_ON_REQUEST' flag unless a governed source confirms specific materials.
P4-INFO: Add standard feature 'pressure_measurement_nipples_included=true' to all cabinet families.
final_report.summary:
The knowledge graph demonstrates strong overall fidelity to the MANN+HUMMEL HVAC Filterskåp catalog (Version 01-09-2025). All 12 product families are present, and the dimension tables for GDP (35 sizes), GDB (27 sizes), GDMI (35 sizes), GDC (12 sizes), GDC FLEX (6 sizes), GDMI FLEX (8 sizes), BFF (5 sizes), and PFF (25 sizes) are complete with correct airflow ratings, cartridge counts, and the vast majority of weight data matching the PDF. Material availability per family is correctly mapped in most cases, and accessory products (PT, TT, EXL, Filter Profil) are all represented.

The most significant issues fall into three clusters. First, data accuracy: one GDB module count (600x900) is incorrectly transcribed, and one GDB weight (1800x900 short=36 kg) is a suspected PDF error that should be escalated rather than stored as-is. Second, semantic modeling: cartridge-based families (GDC, GDC FLEX, GDMI FLEX) use 'max filter depth' terminology when the PDF describes cartridge cylinder lengths — a mismatch that can break filter compatibility logic. Third, governance and defaults: several families lack explicit default material assignments despite clear 'vanligen i...' statements in the PDF, and non-catalog engineering data (chlorine ppm, capacity rules, application heuristics) is not clearly separated from catalog-truth.

With the recommended corrections — particularly fixing the module count error, establishing default materials, renaming cartridge length properties, and improving provenance marking — the graph would achieve a high level of catalog integrity suitable for production use in configuration and recommendation systems.
